Unit Master Documentation

Institutional & Group Member Registration

A clear guide for registering schools, companies, NGOs and other groups as members in Unit Master.

Institutional Members include organisations such as schools, companies, NGOs and community groups. This guide walks you through every step of registering a group account, from capturing group details and contact information to statutory compliance, account preferences and bank instructions.

Institutional / Group Member Registration
Approx. completion time: 7–10 minutes
Organisations & groups
1

Opening the institutional registration form

After logging into Unit Master, navigate to the Members section on the left menu and click Add a New Member. From the member type options, select Institutional / Group to open the correct registration flow.

This wizard is designed to capture information for legal entities, so most fields refer to the group itself rather than to an individual person.

2

Group details Organisation profile

The Group Details step captures the core identity of the organisation:

  • Group Member Name – full legal name of the institution or group (for example “Miriam Keli Muli School”).
  • Industry – select the sector the organisation operates in, such as ICT, Education or Health.
  • Date of Incorporation / Registration – official registration date of the group.
  • Institution Type – choose whether it is a School, Company, NGO, etc.
  • Category – specify if this is a Group or a Company.
  • Registration Number – the official registration number from the regulator.

All required fields must be completed before you can move to the next step. These details form the legal identity of the member in the system.

3

Contact details and communication setup

In the Contact Details section, provide the official contact information for the institution.

Location and address:

  • Postal Address – mailing address for formal correspondence.
  • Postal Code – code identifying the mailing area.
  • Country of Residence – the country where the institution is based.
  • District – regional or administrative district.
  • Town – town or city; a default such as “Dar es Salaam” may appear and can be changed if needed.

Phones and email:

  • Mobile Phone Number – main contact number for SMS alerts.
  • Telephone Number – optional landline or alternative number.
  • Email Address – official email for statements and notifications.

Communication preferences:

  • Accept SMS Notifications? – choose whether to receive SMS alerts.
  • Send SMS Queries? – specify if the system can send queries by SMS.
  • Receive Statement Via? – choose Email or Postage Mail. Email is usually free, while postage may attract a charge.

Additional fields:

  • Website URL – optional website address of the institution.
  • Physical Address – full physical location for visits and documentation.
  • Account Mandate – select how the account is operated (for example, individual signatory, joint signatories or institutional mandate).
4

Statutory details and compliance checks KYC & AML

The Statutory Details step collects information required for KYC, AML and tax reporting.

Client residency and citizenship:

  • Is client resident? – confirm whether the institution is resident in the country.
  • Has dual citizenship? – indicate if applicable to the entity or its principals.
  • Is client a US citizen? – relevant for FATCA screening.

Tax information:

  • Tax No – tax identification number for the institution.
  • Is client tax exempt? – select Yes for tax-exempt organisations.
  • Exempt Certificate Expiry Date – expiry date of the tax exemption certificate.

Compliance and screening:

  • Has Adverse Media Screening Been done? – confirm that the screening was performed.
  • Has Group/Sub Members – indicate whether the institution has sub-members or is part of a larger group.
  • Group Member Logo – optional logo upload for the group profile.
  • Is member a PEP? – state if the entity is linked to a Politically Exposed Person.
  • What is the screening status? – set to True once screening is successfully completed.

Account preferences and document handling:

  • Do you want to withdraw Monthly Interest? – choose whether interest is paid out monthly or reinvested.
  • Is this a suspense account? – mark Yes if the account is temporary or pending verification.
  • Client sign-off date – date the institution signed the documents.
  • Admin received date – date the administrator received the paperwork.
  • Risk Assessment completed date – date of the final risk assessment.
5

Account details for the fund

The Account Details section defines how the institutional member invests with the platform.

  • Fund Name – select the investment fund being opened for the institution.
  • Agent Name – choose the agent or relationship manager responsible for this fund.
  • Fund Description – optional description of the fund’s goal or strategy.
  • Show Tax on Statement? – decide whether tax details are displayed on statements.
  • Note / Instructions – any internal notes or special instructions for staff.
  • Fee Category – select the fee structure that applies (for example, management fee category).
  • Withdraw Dividends? – choose whether dividends are paid out in cash or automatically reinvested.
6

Final review and completion Finish

Once all sections have been completed, review the captured data to ensure names, registration numbers, tax details, contact information and preferences are correct. Confirm that all required fields are filled in and that compliance screening dates have been entered.

When you are satisfied, click Finish to submit the institutional registration. Unit Master will validate the information and create the group member profile so that accounts can start receiving investments and transactions under the selected fund.
